alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 3:34PM EST until March 09 at 9:43AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Indiana including the following counties, Bartholomew, Johnson, Morgan, Shelby, Brown, Jackson, Lawrence, Monroe, Greene and Owen. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 PM EST, River gauge reports indicate rises on area creeks and streams due to earlier heavy rain from thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Area creeks, streams and smaller rivers will remain above flood stage and can be expected to crest and start to fall tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomington, Columbus, Shelbyville, Franklin, Martinsville, Bloomfield, Spencer, Nashville, Ellettsville, Edinburgh, Flat Rock, Worthington, Princes Lakes, Morristown, Trafalgar, Morgantown, Fairland, Clifford, Stinesville and Helmsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
